str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

str2: To disobey, rebel, be disloyal, refuse conformity. From apeithes; to disbelieve.
Jewish. From Iouda; Judaean, i.e. Belonging to Jehudah.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To arouse, stimulate, excite against. From epi and egeiro; to rouse upon, i.e. to excite against.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Probably from etho; a race, i.e. A tribe; specially, a foreign one.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To treat badly, afflict, embitter, make angry. From kakos; to injure; figuratively, to exasperate.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From psucho; breath, i.e. spirit, abstractly or concretely.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.
